intro: Oxydectes regeliana, commonly known as the Regel's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth surface. Oxydectes regeliana is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
